Reviews.Title: “Good location.”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: Near the road. Close to Arecibo observatory and Rio Camuy caves. Friendly staff. Adjacent to restaurant. Nice pool.

Reviews.Title: “Always great service with smiling faces”
Reviews.Author: hokies13vt
Reviews.Content: This was our 5 th time staying here at El Buen Cafe. The attitude of the staff is great. Always asking what can I do for you. We brought our grandkids with us for their 1st visit to Puerto Rico. They loved it and wanted to know if we could move to El Buen Cafe so they could come every year to visit us. It is located right on Rt 2 which makes travel to sights easy. On the west end of the island seems to be much more tourist friendly also. El Nuen cafe is and will continue to be my place to stay when in Puerto Rico. A clean safe and comfrotable place that is also affordable. Ron & Carmen Mason

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: 09beachlovers
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a very good location (if you want to be away from the busy city crowd) and it's very easy to find. It's not very fancy and kinda reminded us of school. It has no eleveators but it makes up with the friendly staff and it's cleanliness. Yes, the beds are made for very short people but are pretty comfy. The pool was a plus and it's very well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Bedding not so bueno....”
Reviews.Author: divecozumel
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here as we were going to the Camuy Caves and the Arecibo Observatory the next day. We were given room 109 and at first we thought it was just a box spring on the floor because it was six inches off the floor and so, so, so hard! Nope, it was a mattress, still wrapped in plastic, so no only are you uncomfortable all night, every time you move it sounds like a baby diaper. We had two very flat hard pillows, no hand towels, no washclothes and 2 towels marked "picina" so they were pool towels to boot. The front desk said couldn't help with more pillows or towels. After we went to dinner, a new desk clerk gave us 2 very nice towels and one hand towel. The room was very clean, television had 20 channels or so, street noise, but not unbearable. If we ever returned to the area, we would stay in San Juan and drive a bit more to be comfortable for the night rather than endure that bed again. Internet not functional, and clerk said it was protected. Asked for the code, and when she found out we were going across the street to their restaurant she said to use their's because it's not protected...what's the big secret with a code? For $120 a night, you could do alot better.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean place to stay with nice people”
Reviews.Author: novoselsky
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, clean place to stay, but it was nothing fancy. I would stay there again because the room was clean, the area seemed safe, and the people at the hotel and cafe across the street were nice. We stayed there on a Wednesday night, and there was a party in the basement. Our room was on the first floor, and if the party had continued later, it definitely would have kept us awake. The other thing I had a hard time with was the price. We paid $107 for the night, which was a pretty good price for a room in Puerto Rico, but you would get a much nicer room in the States for that much money. It was the type of toom you would pay around $50 for up here.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for the money and extremely clean!”
Reviews.Author: keeptraveling01
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not it. But if you are looking for a hotel that is a great deal and really friendly staff, this is your place. The hotel is located close to downtown Arecibo. My room was extremely clean and surprisingly spacious. It had a couch, desk and bed. The hotel is small but that means great customer service. A cafe is across the street for breakfast where a lot of locals eat. I think this would be a great stop over for people traveling through Puerto Rico or for business travelers. It is close to several beaches. Which was very nice as the beaches are beautiful. I would stay here again for sure. It is simple but that was all I needed. It has a pool that was exceptionally clean too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and economic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: NChardon
Reviews.Content: First time staying at a Parador in Puerto Rico and it was a great experience. Very accesible location, nice facilities well kept, very friendly staff, room was very clean, good size room and very clean bathroom! A/C, Cable tv and other amenities. Great deal if you do not want to pay lots of money and you want a nice place to stay. It is definitely a much better deal than staying on a hotel chain. Just a little noise from the street but not that bad. Coffee and bread is included for breakfast and it's delicious. N. Chardon, Miami, FL.

Reviews.Title: “El Buen Night Club / Not so "Buen"”
Reviews.Author: gtvbjt
Reviews.Content: I am currently laying on the bed in my room. It is 11:41 pm. The music from the party directly below my room is about at 80 decibels in my room. I was originally told that the music would end at 10 pm... then I was told 11... and now I am being told 12 midnight. So much for a good night sleep before getting up at 6 am tomorrow! Stay tuned to see how this ends up...

Reviews.Title: “nasty owner!”
Reviews.Author: sobe96
Reviews.Content: i was there for a week for vacacion! the owner was drunk screaming at the employes in front of the coustumers.it was a embarasing moment for me as a coustumer as it was for the poor employe that was triying to act cool about the scolding in front of everybody! as i found out later it seems the owner have a drinking problem for a long time! the premises were clean.but not to much to do unless you have a car to go around! also a lil bit overprised for all i had while i was there! there were other places that have more food for less the price! and the rooms were to small and no view what so ever unless you like to look at neiborhood houses/highway!

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean, restaurant could use some work, cafe was awesome”
Reviews.Author: grub0099
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't my favorite but it was quite cheap. My husband and I just stayed there one night and I don't think a 2nd night would've been too exciting. Our room was clean and well furnished. But our windows looked out onto the parking lot. The ladies at the front desk were very very helpful with all our questions. Even though this hotel isn't on the beach it's a short walk to the ocean. Because Hatillo is on the northern rough Atlantic side of the island there are no ideal swimming beaches. However, there is an amazing rock formation which is partially submerged and you can walk on it (careful, the rocks are very sharp!). When the huge waves crash into these rocks they make huge sprays and all the water drains from rock terrace to terrace, tide pool to tide pool. Very cool to play on. El Buen Cafe the restaurant is actually 2 restaurants. One is, well, a cafe and the other is a "fancy" restaurant. I use that term in quotes because the food they serve sounds fancy and the prices are quite steep. However, the ambiance stinks. When we went the place was almost empty, there is old tattered carpet on the floors and the tables and chairs look like something you'd find at a diner. It really felt (and smelled) like a cheap Chinese place instead of a fancy seafood house. We went to the actual cafe the next morning and LOVED it! I don't know about the rest of the day but our breakfast was wonderful (and cheap!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CallooCallay
Reviews.Content: Parador El Buen CafÃ© is in a convenient but definitely non-scenic location. It is directly on busy Route 2 across from Samâ€™s Club, and is adjacent to a neighborhood of small houses. There is a building across a small side street from the parador which houses the El Buen Cafe restaurant and a cafeteria. We found the staff at this parador to be extremely friendly. They provided us with all the information we asked for about the hotel and about the local area, and gave us towels to use at a nearby beach as well as some free (rum) drink coupons. The hotel room was of adequate size and very clean; the a/c worked well and the beds were comfortable. Room furnishings were adequate but not particularly up-to-date. There is a small pool on the side of the hotel and there is a distant view of the ocean from the windows in the back of the hotel. Dinner at the El Buen CafÃ© restaurant was quite good although the service seemed slow, especially considering that there were very few customers. Breakfast at the El Buen CafÃ© cafeteria was not as good. The morning we were there, the selection was limited, the food quality not very good, and no prices were posted. The price we were charged for a basic scrambled-egg breakfast seemed excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice will go again”
Reviews.Author: enneagram9
Reviews.Content: We found this place by chance in '03 and went back in '07. The rooms are immaculately clean. The staff is courteous and helpful. The Cafe across the street is a real taste of PR and the restaurant is an upscale version. The pool looks nice, tho I haven't had time to go into it. Will gladly stay there again if I am in PR again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great!”
Reviews.Author: JanetteCarrasquillo
Reviews.Content: Very, very friendly staff. They always smile and say hello. I didn't have to ask anything. They gave all the information I needed. Comfortable rooms. Incredibly clean. Nice view. Very comfortable beds. Space for all your luggage. Small refrigerator. Bathrooms are very clean, with everything you may need, even a small hair dryer. Food at the cafereria is great, and the service, excelent and fast. The pool is good for the whole family. You have everything near: beach, shopping mall, gas station, etc.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Maximilian4eva
Reviews.Content: This was a fine stop-over stay on our way from the San Juan airport to the southwestern part of the island. We stayed for one night. The room was spacious, clean, and quiet, and appropriately priced. The staff was pleasant enough and gave us directions when we checked out. The hotel is located less than a mile away from a nice beach that is frequented by families and locals. We didn't eat at the cafe across the street, or hang around Hatillo long enough to get a feel for the town. Overall, though, the hotel was a comfortable place to stay for one night. One note: we didn't actually see an elevator in the hotel. I would advise anyone who needs handicap accommodations (or who has a lot of heavy luggage) to check with the front desk before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff but limited pool hours”
Reviews.Author: bustraveler_9
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, but they have limited hours for their pool used. As a traveler you are going to spend most of the day moving around and will hope for a place to unwind on the evenings. The Parador itself was very nice but they close the pool at 6PM so if you want to relax by the pool after a long day of sighseeing this is not the place for you. But in the other hand if you want a friendly and helpfull staff then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy, but good”
Reviews.Author: CyberTalos
Reviews.Content: Overall, the Buen Cafe is a simple hotel that is a good place to spend a night or two if you are looking for a place near the Rio Camuy Caves and the Arecibo Observatory. The hotel is right off the highway, which makes it easy to find, but also means that it is not in a scenic location. But there is a beautiful small beach just a couple of minutes (driving) away that the hotel staff can direct you to. The rooms are nothing fancy, but they are clean and have good beds. The hotel is fairly small, so there are not many services available. There is diner-like restaurant across the street that is affiliated with the hotel. The food was fine, but nothing to get excited about. The hotel staff was pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: bobretired
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect place to say for us on the north coast becasue we wanted to visit the telescope one afternoon and the caves the next morning. Its about 30 minutes from the hotel for both. The rooms were clean large and the staff was very accomodating. The restaurant ( cafe) across the street is great for breakfast or a light dinner or lunch. If you want a larger meal use the formal dining room at the restaurant attached.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: BostonIndian
Reviews.Content: Talk about service - this place was amazing. We got to Hatillo around 6:30 PM, and we were given our room. We were handed our remote (apparently people walk away with the remote controls to the TVs) and were told not to use to towels to clean cars, polish shoes or color our hair (apparently that's all been done there!). We were given directions and times to the cafe that opens really early and the restaurant along with two free drink coupons. The room was big and clean. The shower had good water pressure. The room was on the first floor. That's when the BOOM BOOM sounds started. The wedding party in the meeting room in the basement shook our rooms. So right after we took a shower we asked for a change of rooms since the party was to go till midnight as per the front desk. The lady at the front desk apoligized and took us to the other wing of the parador across the road (that's where the cafe and the restaurant are). This room was slightly smaller (and cheaper - I got a refund) but seemed to be newer construction. This room was clean too... and quiet. The beds were comfortable and except for the loading dock noises early the next morning, we had a rested stay. The restaurant on the first floor -the food is good... our wait staff was a bit stand offish - seemed like they were going thru the chores. They had a singer crooning Spanish songs (sounded like my Julio Iglesias CDs I love to listen but don't understand!) Checkout was a breeze. The staff helped us with tips to get to the Caverns and Arecibo. The bad side: There seems to be a lot of locks and iron grills on the outer doors which gave me the impression that it's probably a high theft area. We however did not encounter or hear anything

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, the staff helpful, and the food at the diner was really great! We stayed two nights, the first was very quiet, the second night (a Saturday) it was terribly noisy, (it was noise in the neighborhood, not in the building. ) Parking was also difficult on Saturday due to the fact there was a wedding reception there. Overall, a very nice time though. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a cozy wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When my daughter got married, we lived in the Island, and I booked hotel rooms for all my guests from the mainland. They had a wonderful time, and service was excellent. Would stay again.

HotelInfo.Name: Parador El Buen Cafe Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 381 Ctra 2 | Bo Carrizales, Hatillo 00659, Puerto Rico
